archetypes.name: Limits to Growth (Limits to Success)
archetypes.rationale: Reinforcing growth loops exist (Project Reputation → Joining Rate → New Contributors → PR Feedback → Software Quality and Features → Project Reputation; plus Searchable Knowledge Base reinforcing explicit knowledge). Growth is implicitly constrained by limited review/mentoring capacity, documentation backlog, and maintainer time, which raise PR Review Delay, Onboarding Friction, and Newcomer Dropout Rate. Making the capacity constraint and WIP pressure explicit clarifies the balancing loop that arrests growth.

variables.name: Review Capacity
variables.description: Effective pull request review throughput given available people and mentoring capacity
variables.rationale: Makes the implicit capacity constraint explicit to complete the balancing loop

variables.name: PR WIP Pressure
variables.description: Overload signal from pull requests relative to review capacity
variables.rationale: Links accumulated PRs to rising delays and lowering contributor experience

variables.name: Maintainer Workload
variables.description: Aggregate workload from open issues and PRs awaiting action
variables.rationale: Translates growing WIP into reduced available time and higher turnover

connections.rationale: More core developers increase potential review throughput
Experienced contributors contribute to reviews
Greater mentoring capacity supports higher effective review throughput
More available time enables higher throughput
More PRs in the system raise overload pressure
Higher capacity reduces overload for a given PR volume
Overload lengthens review wait times
More issues increase workload
More PRs increase workload
Higher workload reduces discretionary available time per person
Sustained overload increases burnout and turnover
Long delays erode perceived safety
Lower safety increases dropout

archetypes.name: Growth and Underinvestment
archetypes.rationale: As the project grows, performance demands on onboarding and documentation rise (Documentation Backlog, Onboarding Friction). If investment in documentation/curation capacity lags, performance deteriorates, slowing growth, which then further suppresses investment—locking in underinvestment. Making capacity, investment, and decision delay explicit completes this archetype.

variables.name: Documentation and Onboarding Capacity
variables.description: Sustained capability to produce and curate high-quality, discoverable knowledge artifacts
variables.rationale: Endogenizes the capability that drives documentation throughput and quality

variables.name: Capacity Investment Rate
variables.description: Rate of investing in processes, tooling, and roles that increase documentation/curation capacity
variables.rationale: Captures the decision to invest (or underinvest) as demand grows

variables.name: Capacity Depreciation Rate
variables.description: Loss of documentation/curation capability due to staff turnover, tool obsolescence, and process decay

variables.name: Onboarding Performance Gap
variables.description: Gap between Target Onboarding Friction and actual Onboarding Friction

variables.name: Target Onboarding Friction
variables.description: Desired level of friction for newcomers based on strategy
variables.rationale: Reference level needed to define the performance gap

connections.rationale: Higher capacity increases throughput given the same time and tooling
Better capacity supports more curation
Capacity enables higher-quality artifacts
A larger backlog worsens onboarding experience
Higher actual friction increases the gap
A lower target increases the measured gap for the same actual friction
A larger gap triggers more investment (unless underinvestment behavior dominates)
Available time enables making investments (planning, tooling setup)
Overload crowds out investment activities
Depreciation erodes capacity

archetypes.name: Shifting the Burden
archetypes.rationale: Short-term relief comes from maintainers directly pushing reviews and mentoring (symptomatic fix), reducing PR Review Delay and helping newcomers. The fundamental solution is to strengthen self-service and community capability (explicit knowledge, practices, documentation capacity) to lower Onboarding Friction. Reliance on the symptomatic path increases Maintainer Workload and Developer's Turnover, undermining mentoring and community practices, thus weakening the fundamental solution.

variables.name: Symptomatic Reliance on Maintainers
variables.description: Degree to which the project leans on direct maintainer effort to move PRs and onboard newcomers

connections.rationale: More maintainer effort directly increases review throughput (symptomatic relief)
Greater reliance drives higher time allocation to hands-on review/mentoring
Overreliance diverts effort from building shared practices (fundamental solution)
Better explicit knowledge reduces friction (fundamental solution)
Strong practices reduce friction via norms and predictable processes
Backlogs pressure the team to double down on direct effort
Overwork increases burnout and exit, weakening the fundamental path
Turnover reduces available mentors, undermining long-term capability
Higher capacity supports the capability-building path
